item.title: Blocked rainwater gully at the foot of St Augustine's Tower, 23rd January
item.description:
A council owned building looked after by Hackney Historic Buildings Trust. The single gulley drains rainwater from the roof of Hackney's oldest building and is used by food traders to dispose of food waste. It is blocked and and needs very urgent attention
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mare Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement trip hazard, 23rd January
item.description:
Roots from tree lifting pavement up causing trip hazard. Have tripped over it several times already. By the first silver birch tree as you turn right from Combermere rd on to Hargwyne st

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hargwyne Street, Stockwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing Give-Way sign on Glanville Road, 23rd January
item.description:
The give-way sign on Glanville Road at the intersection with Woldham Road has been missing since last summer following an accident. Although the new pole and light have been installed some time before Christmas, the sign still hasn't appeared - please can you provide an update on when this will be completed, as the junction is dangerous without it, as people sometimes drive straight over without stopping (as the accidents go to show). Thanks for your help.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glanville Road, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hazard, 23rd January
item.description:
A large fridge has been dumped on footway on Mottingham lane SE9 next damaged lamp post that was damaged in September 2025 and still NOT replaced which is a hazard as you have to walk near the kerb and as cars driving up the road with headlights on , it is to see where you are walking
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mottingham Lane, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 23rd January
item.description:
Someone has put about four bags of rubbish again in the same place. This happened on Thursday between 6 pm and I think 11:30 pm at night the bags are still there now. Can you please clear them away?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensbridge Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Thick mud caked on the road, near tree on Eden Park Avenue, opposite St Johnâ€™s Church, 23rd January
item.description:
This mud has been here for at least 6 months and the pile only gets bigger. It has blocked the drain and this is evident whenever it rains as a large puddle is created making it difficult for people to access their cars/cross the street without jumping or walking down a significant portion of the road and then walking back. Address: Eden Park Avenue, BR33JL, near the corner of Merlin Grove opposite the church hall and the vicarage

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Park Avenue, Eden Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
